node.title: Letters to the Editor on the 125th Anniversary Issue
node.description: Readers respond to recent issues of the Sunday Book Review.
node.content: ["To the Editor:", " I settled in Monday evening for a read-through of the 125th anniversary issue (Oct. 24), expecting the usual slog, though a bit longer than usual (I didn\u2019t finish until Tuesday afternoon).", "Pleasantly surprised to find a sampling of features and reviews across the Book Review\u2019s lifespan, I made my way through with the usual combination of smiles at well-turned phrases, shrugs at boring passages, annoyance at what I considered ill-considered opinions and chuckles at well-placed bons mots.", "I was nearing the end when I reached Page 54 and the late Neil Sheehan\u2019s essay on the question of American war crimes in Vietnam, which was originally published not long before The Times\u2019s publication of the Pentagon Papers after a long legal battle with the ever-stonewalling Nixon administration, an achievement in which Sheehan was instrumental.", "Too young to have the read the piece when it first published, I was rapt and impressed by its unfading relevance more than half a century after it first ran. I don\u2019t usually hold on to anniversary issues, but Sheehan\u2019s essay and its timelessness made this a permanent keeper.", "Mac Brachman Chicago", "\u2666", "To the Editor:", " I have mixed feelings skimming through the commemorative issue that marks the 125th anniversary of the Book Review.", "The good, and understandable part: Every page is filled with a past review by or about some remarkable author or classic work. James Joyce, Toni Morrison, Colson Whitehead, Edith Wharton, Sandra Cisneros, Amy Tan, Vladimir Nabokov \u2014 on and on.", "The bad: It would take me all week to read the damned thing. But it\u2019s impressive.", "David A. Scott Columbus, Ohio", "\u2666", "To the Editor:", " Thank you for this incredible gift. Such marvelous pieces to read by so many wonderful authors. And those letters to the Book Review are just amazing.", "This issue will be in our home for a long time to come, so that we can pick it up at any time and enjoy reliving history.", "Harvey Glassman Boynton Beach, Fla.", "\u2666", "To the Editor:", " As a writer whose letters have occasionally appeared in the Book Review, I lift my pen to you. Your special issue celebrating 125 years was remarkable. I was delighted to read everything from Mario Puzo\u2019s review of William F. Buckley Jr.\u2019s \u201cThe Jeweler\u2019s Eye\u201d to Herbert S. Gorman\u2019s review of Countee Cullen\u2019s \u201cColor.\u201d", "Gorman lists two epitaphs by Cullen \u2014 of the two, I especially like this one:", "To the next 125 years!", "David TulanianLas Vegas", "\u2666", "To the Editor:", " Thank you and the book publishers.", "On a humorous note, I might have included G. Gordon Liddy\u2019s 1993 review of a Tom Clancy book, \u201cWithout Remorse.\u201d Liddy wrote that Clancy\u2019s description of making a firearm suppressor was incorrect.", "Michael BognerBel Air, Md.", "\u2666", "To the Editor:", " What a terrible waste of paper.", "Salomon LipinerNew York", ""]
